item.title: Gurukula Botanical Sanctuary is quietly reviving a part of the Western Ghats
item.description: In the times of shrinking forests and quick-fix plantation drives, a small community at the Gurukula Botanical Sanctuary is doing something truly special. For the last 44 years, this small group of “gardeners in service to forests” has been patiently nurturing a part of the Western Ghats, bringing degraded lands back to life. What they have achieved is mind-boggling. They have managed to grow and propagate over 2000 native plant species.
